sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A heat engine takes in heat from a source at 600 K and rejects heat to a sink at 300 K. Calculate the Carnot efficiency of the engine.
message_2:
The Carnot efficiency is the maximum possible efficiency for a heat engine operating between two temperatures. It is given by the formula:

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir (in Kelvin) and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir (in Kelvin).

In this case, T_hot = 600 K and T_cold = 300 K. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 600 K) = 1 - 0.5 = 0.5

So the Carnot efficiency of the engine is 0.5 or 50%.
